# accessibilityChildren()

**Instance Method**

Returns the accessibility element’s children in the accessibility hierarchy.

## Declaration

```swift
func accessibilityChildren() -> [Any]?
```

## Return Value

An array that contains references to this element’s children in the accessibility hierarchy.

## Discussion

This method is the getter for the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibilityProtocol] protocol’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-c.protocol/accessibilityChildren] property.

## Related Documentation

- **accessibilityAddChildElement(_:)**: Adds a child to the accessibility element in the accessibility hierarchy.
- **unignoredChildrenForOnlyChild(from:)**: Returns a list of unignored accessibility objects, descending the hierarchy, if necessary.
- **unignoredChildren(from:)**: Returns a list of unignored accessibility objects, descending the hierarchy, if necessary.

## Supporting Accessibility

- **accessibilityFocusedUIElement**: The child accessibility element with the current focus.
- **accessibilityLabel()**: Returns a short description of the layout area.
- **accessibilitySelectedChildren()**: Returns the layout area’s currently selected children.
